alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Davidson County through 530 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oak Hill, or near Nashville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Nashville, Brentwood, La Vergne, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Belle Meade, Antioch, Berry Hill, Beaman Park, Bells Bend and Whites Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 198 and 218. Interstate 65 between mile markers 74 and 89. Interstate 24 between mile markers 43 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
